alert.note: Alert for Brown; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 10:12AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River at Ashton affecting Spink County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. James River at Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Stratford. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, 395th Avenue is flooded and the road and bridge on 146th Street is under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 18.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Sunday was 18.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued on Tuesday.
